adjective.description: Unassuming or moderate in the estimation of one's abilities or achievements.
examples: he was a very modest man, refusing to take any credit for the enterprise
synonyms: keeping one's light under a bushel

adjective.description: (of an amount, rate, or level) relatively moderate, limited, or small.
(of a woman) dressing or behaving so as to avoid impropriety or indecency, especially to avoid attracting sexual attention.

origin: Mid 16th century: from French modeste, from Latin modestus keeping due measure, related to modus measure.
